name: Ensure setting origins when using @CrossOrigin Spring annotation
description:
This rule reports usage of @CrossOrigin Spring annotation :
  - without setting "origins" or "originPatterns" or "value"
  - setting one of them to "*" or "null"
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: Leaving the "origins" parameter unset in the @CrossOrigin annotation allows requests from any origin, increasing the risk of unauthorized access and potential exploitation of exposed API endpoints by malicious websites.
reference:
CWE-346: Origin Validation Error
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/346.html

OWASP - HTTP Security Response Headers Cheat Sheet
https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/HTTP_Headers_Cheat_Sheet.html#access-control-allow-origin
remediation: Define a whitelist of authorized origins and pass it to @CrossOrigin.
alternativeName: Avoid using @CrossOrigin Spring annotation without any restriction
